ygData.subject: Re:places to solo from 15 - 27 im asking where to go from  27 to 34 lv and up?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... The Gnoll side is also good but you may need a partner unless the area is being camped, or the spawn is broken up a bit East Karana Reavers are also good
ygData.messageBody:
>lv 15 - 20 Highhold pass orc side, when there is only one group you can
>start taking one of low lv orcs wich spawn here at madly rates and after
>this meditating, beter to go to gnoll side if there are to much kill
>stealers as you will be incriminated of KS by your mare presence as wizard
>there.

The Gnoll side is also good but you may need a partner unless the area is
being camped, or the spawn is broken up a bit

East Karana Reavers are also good in this range Gorge hounds and the
snakes out there are good too. Stay away from the griffon type stuff.
They may not have alot of HPs but they hit REALLY hard.

>20 - 23 Lake rathe Aviac guards (near zone to Arena), soulsek A entrance
>tunel(careful of lava), Tentacle terors in najena (root, enstill one and
>run to zone where you can fight other in peace)

20 - mid 30s For soloing the Bird cage in South Karana is pretty good but
its relatively camped at all hours. Just be kind to others and if your
patient you will find stuff to fight.

>23 - 28 Mistmore lake and canyon area(pull with eye, root one if 2 commes
>and fight near zone), soulsek a safe room near zone to Nefagens lair(
>enstill one, root and kill other in safe room then zone a sec to kobolds
>lair if you dont have enough mana to kill other one, careful if greater
>kobold is not camped zone back and meditate invisible) this two places are
>dangerus in any case as you can pull caster wich have low hip points but
>cast force shock wich is realy dangerus (i have mag resistance 65 and i
>resist one of 8 times :( only)
>
>This was my bit of advices for lower lv any other from 27 to 50 is
>apreciated :)

Personally I don't like to solo. Its god awful boring. They exp may be
aver so slightly better but those long sessions of medding make it very
dull when working alone.

>P.S. i tryed to go to najena but im still to low to solo there in i tryed
>BC room ... died, named necros are to high other dont give me exp anymore,
>ogre captain is lv 27 white to me and it finish very bad... sow runned to
>zone with 5 hp :-)

Well I hate to say it but you missed out on the fun in Najean. I started
in Najena at around level 16 and went there off and on till about level 24.
Sure the Oger captain and the 3 major NPCs are still good to kill for me
but najena is definately what I would call a good group dungeon. There
aren't nearely as many trains as some of the other dungeons (guk for
instance), but its not a place I would recomend for soloing unless you like
to zone in and out alot.

Although I have never tried it solo I believe I could (at 34th) kill
cyclopses in the Rathe Mts. And I have herd that at about 36th a friend of
mine said he soloed a Hill Giant. But you better prey your root holds
because darn they hit hard. Hill Giants and Griffons are blue into the
upper 40s. (so I hear)

Again I would just like to mention. IMO we (wizards) are NOT a solo class.
Sure we can solo a bit, assuming our root holds up, but we work great in
groups. Once you crack level 29 you become so much more useful to a group.
I can sum up this new advantage in four words. "Evac to North Karana"
I can't tell you how many times I have saved my group by keeping this spell
handy. I usually wait for the call from the lead group healer. If he is
OOM and we still have lost to fight. its Evac time.

Lomack, Knight Defender of the BCK
Master of Recruiting
www.bck.org
"The Crimson Knights"
Fennin Ro
